Links I Think Are Useful:


  • lainchan: An image board focused on cyberpunk and technology related content, frequently features interesting programming posts.
  • hackaday: A blog which contains many interesting hacks related to hardware and software.
  • archlinux: The archwiki is a very useful source of configuration/installation info for lots of linux software.
  • /r/prog on reddit: A subreddit containg lots of interesting programming news and posts.
  • /r/linux on reddit: A subreddit containg lots of interesting linux news and posts.
  • libgen: Books.
  • w3schools: I tend to look up lots of html css and js stuff here.
  • jsfiddle: A good place to demo/test simple web projects for yourself.
  • Geogebra: An online geometry utility.
  • Interactive Math Site List: A list of interactive math sites from the subreddit /r/math
  • List Of Free Online Math Resources: A list of free online math resources from the subreddit /r/math
  • GIMP: The GNU image manipulation program, a FOSS image editor.
  • Ardour: A FOSS digital audio workstation
  • LMMS: Another FOSS digital audio workstation
  • ThreeJS: A cool library/api fpr creating 3d graphics in the browser.
  • onlinesequencer.net: An online midi sequencer.
  • Vocaroo: A website for posting short audio clips/files.
  • Imgur: A website for posting and sharing images.
  • Soundcloud: A website for posting audio and music.
